Package: org.christianschenk.simplecache

[Java] Class SimpleCache<T>

    • org.christianschenk.simplecache.SimpleCache

    • This class provides a very simple implementation of an object cache.

      Authors:
      Christian Schenk

      • Field Summary

          Fields 
          Modifiers Name Description
          private long  defaultExpire The default expiration date
          private java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.Long>  expire Holds custom expiration dates
          private java.util.Map<java.lang.String, T>  objects Objects are stored here
          private java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService  threads Is used to speed up some operations

      • Constructor Summary

          Constructors 
          Constructor and description
          SimpleCache ()
          Constructs the cache with a default expiration time for the objects of 100 seconds.
          SimpleCache (long defaultExpire)
          Construct a cache with a custom expiration date for the objects.

      • Methods Summary

          Methods 
          Type Name and description
          private java.lang.Runnable createRemoveRunnable(java.lang.String name)
          Returns a runnable that removes a specific object from the cache.
          T get(java.lang.String name)
          Returns an object from the cache.
          R get(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Class<R> type)
          Convenience method.
          long getExpire()
          Returns the default expiration time for the objects in the cache.
          void put(java.lang.String name, T obj)
          Put an object into the cache.
          void put(java.lang.String name, T obj, long expireTime)
          Put an object into the cache with a custom expiration date.
          private java.lang.Runnable removeExpired()
          This Runnable removes expired objects.

          Constructs the cache with a default expiration time for the objects of 100 seconds.

      • Method Detail

        • private final java.lang.Runnable createRemoveRunnable(java.lang.String name)

          Returns a runnable that removes a specific object from the cache.

          Parameters:
          name - the name of the object

        • public T get(java.lang.String name)

          Returns an object from the cache.

          Parameters:
          name - the name of the object you'd like to get
          type - the type of the object you'd like to get
          Returns:
          the object for the given name and type

        • @java.lang.SuppressWarningsssWarnings("unchecked") public public R get(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Class<R> type)

          Convenience method.

        • public long getExpire()

          Returns the default expiration time for the objects in the cache.

          Returns:
          default expiration time in seconds

        • public void put(java.lang.String name, T obj)

          Put an object into the cache.

          Parameters:
          name - the object will be referenced with this name in the cache
          obj - the object

        • public void put(java.lang.String name, T obj, long expireTime)

          Put an object into the cache with a custom expiration date.

          Parameters:
          name - the object will be referenced with this name in the cache
          obj - the object
          expire - custom expiration time in seconds

        • private final java.lang.Runnable removeExpired()

          This Runnable removes expired objects.
